tei:classSpec.tei:desc: This attribute class provides attributes needed to define a rubato.

tei:attDef.tei:desc: The length of a rubato frame (in symbolic time), i.e. the time window within which the timing deviation takes place and compensates again.
The intensity of the rubato's timing distortion effect.

tei:remarks.tei:p: This attribute specifies the type of the rubato distortion: short-long (0.0 < intensity < 1.0; e.g. Viennese waltz), long-short (1.0 < intensity; e.g. swing timing), even timing (intensity = 1.0). The more the value differs from 0.0 the more pronounced is the rubato distortion.

tei:attDef.tei:desc: Add an initial delay to the rubato frame.

tei:remarks.tei:p: The allowed value range is 0.0 ≤ lateStart < earlyEnd ≤ 1.0. It is not reasonable to shift the initial delay past the end point. The values are relative to the length of the rubato frame, i.e., 0.0 is the beginning and 1.0 corresponds with the end of the rubato frame.
